Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now let me analyze the raw log: 1. 08:59:50 - FOCUS Word (Quarterly_Report.docx) 2. 09:00:00 - FOCUS Word (Document1.docx) ... 26. 09:08:15 - CLOSE Word (Quarterly_Report.docx)

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I see several distinct work objects: - Document1.docx (Word) - Email - Inbox/Annual Meeting (Chrome) - Report_Draft.pdf (Acrobat) - Budget_2024.xlsx (Excel) - Quarterly_Report.docx (Word)

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Possible case identification approaches: 1. Artifact-centric: Each document/email is a separate case. 2. Session-centric: The entire time period is one case... 3. Task-centric: Group by logical task.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Given process mining best practices, artifact-centric (document-centric) cases usually make the most sense for office work analysis. This allows analyzing the lifecycle of specific documents.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Case 1: Document1_Draft - This includes the initial writing (09:00:00-09:01:45), the research phase (email, pdf, excel), and the finalization (09:06:00-09:07:00).

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: However, to keep it clean and analyst-friendly, I will treat each artifact as its own case, and use the SWITCH events to indicate the transition, assigning them to the leaving case or the entering case.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: SWITCH out = End of current case or Switch Context activity within current case? SWITCH in = Start of new case or Resume Work activity? Given that we have explicit FOCUS events for the destination, I can treat SWITCH as the end of the previous case.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: This suggests Document1.docx work is the main case, with the other activities being sub-tasks or research activities supporting it. However, in process mining, we typically want each event to belong to exactly one case.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Raw actions Activity Names: - FOCUS Open Document or Resume Editing - TYPING Edit Content - SAVE Save Document - SWITCH Switch Context or Pause Task - CLICK specific actions - SCROLL Review Content - HIGHLIGHT Annotate Document - CLOSE Close Document

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Instead of generic Edit Content, I could use more specific names based on the context: - For Document1: Draft Introduction, Add Details, Insert Budget Reference
